# Introduction  (Rose)
Hurricane Irene was a tropical cyclone that impacted the Caribbean, the Atlantic coast of the United States and Canada in late August of 2011. The storm made landfall in North Carolina on August 27th and, as a result, there were five deaths. Peak wind speeds were 115 mph.  
This storm caused extensive damage to infrastructure along the coast. 

```{r, fig.align = 'center', out.width = "75%", fig.cap = "Hurricane Irene making landfall at 07:49 on August 27, 2011 Source: https://www.weather.gov/mhx/Aug272011EventReview"}
knitr::include_graphics(here::here("landfall.jpg"))
```
